paper.title: An implementation of the general number field sieve
paper.abstract: It was shown in [2] that under reasonable assumptions the general number field sieve (GNFS) is the asymptotically fastest known factoring algorithm. It is, however, not known how this algorithm behaves in practice. In this report we describe practical experience with our implementation of the GNFS whose first version was completed in January 1993 at the Department of Computer Science at the Universit?t des Saarlandes.
